title: How to Clean a Bedroom In Zones

steps.headline: Gather cleaning supplies and clean the room!
steps.description: Throw out any garbage, remove dirty clothes, and donate clothes that don't fit. This will give you the physical space and mental concentration you'll need organize your bedroom.

steps.headline: Divide your bedroom into four zones: The Sleeping Zone, The Relaxing Zone, The Work Zone, and The Grooming & Changing Zone.
steps.description: It may help to draw a floor plan of your bedroom and color each zone a different color with crayons or colored pencils.

steps.headline: Take a duster and dust your lamps and end tables.
Put books back on the bookcase.
Straighten your blankets, pillows, and stuffed animals.
If anything you find is relaxing to you, put it in a place where you can unwind.
Straighten the bookcases, dust the easel, prop up the guitar; clean it up!
Add some pillows and a blanket to soften the area.
If you have a TV or stereo, place it here in this area if the layout of your room allows you.
This is where you will probably do homework and study, so add a desk and a bookcase.
Setup the computer in this area.
Add some pencil tins and several desk organizers.
Place a backpack hook on the wall next to the desk.
This area will probably span the area near your closet and in your closet.
steps.description: Make sure to organize your closet or wardrobe!

steps.headline: Place a vanity inside or right next to your closet.
steps.description: This will make getting ready a breeze!

steps.headline: Place a few organizers for brushes, hair ties, makeup and other miscellaneous grooming devices.
